page.title: 06HEALTH
page.content: In Charlton Kings, six doctors work in a group practice. They have a new purpose built health centre in the London Road. There is a separate dental practice at the centre. Also attached to the health centre is a health visitor who helps with young children and the house-bound. Residents use the Cheltenham General Hospital which is only about a mile away. Old people are catered for in three old people's homes: Nazareth House, Greville House and East Court. Nazareth House is run by a Roman Catholic Order and residents pay Â£95 per week, with a reduced rate for those who cannot afford it. Greville House and East Court are run by the Social Services Department of Gloucestershire County Council.
